info.name: üìÑ Zoo API
info.description:
# ü¶Åüêòü¶íüêí

This is the documentation for the API developed for managing comments and responses to animals in a zoo.

## **Getting started guide**

`List the steps or points required to start using your APIs. Make sure to cover everything required to reach success with your API as quickly as possible.`

To start using the ((add APIs here)), you need to -

`The points given below are from The Postman API's documentation. You can reference it to write your own getting started guide.`

- You must use a valid API Key to send requests to the API endpoints. You can get your API key from Postman's [integrations dashboard](https://go.postman.co/settings/me/api-keys).
    
- The API has [rate and usage limits](https://learning.postman.com/docs/developer/postman-api/postman-api-rate-limits/).
    
- The API only responds to HTTPS-secured communications. Any requests sent via HTTP return an HTTP 301 redirect to the corresponding HTTPS resources.
    
- The API returns request responses in JSON format. When an API request returns an error, it is sent in the JSON response as an error key.
    

## Authentication

`Add details on the authorization keys/tokens required, steps that cover how to get them, and the relevant error codes.`

The ((product name)) API uses ((add your API's authorization type)) for authentication.

`The details given below are from the Postman API's documentation. You can reference it to write your own authentication section.`

Postman uses API keys for authentication. You can generate a Postman API key in the [API keys](https://postman.postman.co/settings/me/api-keys) section of your Postman account settings.

You must include an API key in each request to the Postman API with the X-Api-Key request header.

### Authentication error response

If an API key is missing, malformed, or invalid, you will receive an HTTP 401 Unauthorized response code.

## Rate and usage limits

`Use this section to cover your APIs' terms of use. Include API limits, constraints, and relevant error codes, so consumers understand the permitted API usage and practices.`

`The example given below is from The Postman API's documentation. Use it as a reference to write your APIs' terms of use.`

API access rate limits apply at a per-API key basis in unit time. The limit is 300 requests per minute. Also, depending on your plan, you may have usage limits. If you exceed either limit, your request will return an HTTP 429 Too Many Requests status code.

Each API response returns the following set of headers to help you identify your use status:

| Header | Description |
| --- | --- |
| `X-RateLimit-Limit` | The maximum number of requests that the consumer is permitted to make per minute. |
| `X-RateLimit-Remaining` | The number of requests remaining in the current rate limit window. |
| `X-RateLimit-Reset` | The time at which the current rate limit window resets in UTC epoch seconds. |

### 503 response

An HTTP `503` response from our servers indicates there is an unexpected spike in API access traffic. The server is usually operational within the next five minutes. If the outage persists or you receive any other form of an HTTP `5XX` error, [contact support](https://support.postman.com/hc/en-us/requests/new/).

### **Need some help?**

`Add links that customers can refer to whenever they need help.`

In case you have questions, go through our tutorials ((link to your video or help documentation here)). Or visit our FAQ page ((link to the relevant page)).

Or you can check out our community forum, there‚Äôs a good chance our community has an answer for you. Visit our developer forum ((link to developer forum)) to review topics, ask questions, and learn from others.

`You can also document or add links to libraries, code examples, and other resources needed to make a request.`

item.name: Admin
Zona

request.description:
This endpoint is used to create a new zoo zone.

## Example input

``` json
{
  "name": "Anfibios"
}

 ```

### Request Body

- `name`: (string) Zone's name
    

## Example output

``` json
{
  "id": 10,
  "name": "Anfibios"
}

 ```

In case the zone name is already registered

```
La zona Reptiles ya existe.

 ```

### Response

- `id`: (number) zone's ID
    
- `name`: (string) zone's name

The endpoint is used to update an existing zoo zone identified by the provided ID.

## Example input

``` json
{
  "name": "Anfibios"
}

 ```

### Request Body

- `name`: (string) Zone's name
    

## Example output

``` json
{
  "id": 10,
  "name": "Anfibios"
}

 ```

In case the zone name is already registered

```
La zona Reptiles ya existe.

 ```

This endpoint retrieves information about a specific zone.

### Request

No request body is required for this endpoint.

```
GET /api/v1/zone/123
 ```

#### Parameters

- `id` (path parameter) - The ID of the zone to retrieve.
    

### Response

The response will be a JSON object with the following schema:

``` json
{
  "id": "number",
  "name": "string"
}

 ```

#### Example

##### Request

```
GET /api/v1/zone/123

 ```

##### Response

``` json
{
  "id": 123,
  "name": "Example Zone"
}

 ```

This endpoint retrieves all existing zoo zones

### Request

No request body is required for this endpoint.

```
GET /api/v1/zone

 ```

### Response

The response will be a JSON object with the following schema:

``` json
[  
 {
    "id": "number",
    "name": "string"
  },
  {
    "id": "number",
    "name": "string"
  }
]

 ```

#### Example

##### Request

```
GET /api/v1/zone

 ```

##### Response

``` json
[
  {
    "id": 123,
    "name": "Example Zone"
  },
  {
    "id": 124,
    "name": "Example Zone2"
  }
]

 ```

This endpoint is used to delete a specific zone.

#### Request

No request body is required for this endpoint.

``` http
  DELETE /api/v1/zone/{{id}}

 ```

#### Response

- Status: 204 In successful case.
    
- Status:404 In case the zone does not exist
    
- Status:409 In case of error when deleting due to conflict and in this case it returns:
    

```
No se puede eliminar una zona con animales asociados

 ```

item.description: Set of endpoints that allow CRUD to be performed in the zoo's zones.

item.name: Species

request.description:
This endpoint is used to delete a specific species.

#### Request

No request body is required for this endpoint.

``` http
  DELETE /api/v1/species/{{id}}

 ```

#### Response

- Status: 204 In successful case.
    
- Status:404 In case the species does not exist
    
- Status:409 In case of error when deleting due to conflict and in this case it returns:
    

```
No se puede eliminar una especie con animales asociados

 ```

This endpoint retrieves information about a specific species.

### Request

No request body is required for this endpoint.

#### Parameters

- `id` (path parameter) - The ID of the species to retrieve.
    

### Response

The response will be a JSON object with the following schema:

``` json
{
  "id": "number",
  "name": "string"
}

 ```

#### Example

##### Request

```
GET /api/v1/species/123

 ```

##### Response

``` json
{
  "id": 123,
  "name": "Example species"
}

 ```

The endpoint is used to update an existing zoo species identified by the provided ID.

## Example input

``` json
{
  "name": "Salamandra"
}

 ```

### Request Body

- `name`: (string) Species's name
    

## Example output

``` json
{
    "id": 1,
    "zone": {
        "id": 1,
        "name": "Anfibios"
    },
    "name": "Salamandra"
}

 ```

In case the species name is already registered

```
La especie Salamandra ya existe.

 ```

This endpoint is used to create a new zoo species.

## Example input

``` json
{
    "name": "Rana",
    "zone": 1
}

 ```

### Request Body

- `name`: (string) Species's name
    
- zone: (number) Zone's id
    

## Example output

``` json
{
    "id": 4,
    "zone": {
        "id": 1,
        "name": "Anfibios"
    },
    "name": "Rana"
}

 ```

In case the species name is already registered

```
La especie Rana ya existe.

 ```

### Response

- `id`: (number) Species's ID
    
- `name`: (string) Species's name
    
- zone: (object) Zone to which the species belongs

item.description: Set of endpoints that allow CRUD to be performed in the zoo's species.

item.name: Animal

request.description:
This endpoint is used to delete a specific animal.

#### Request

No request body is required for this endpoint.

``` http
  DELETE /api/v1/animal/{{id}}

 ```

#### Response

- Status: 204 In successful case.
    
- Status:404 In case the species does not exist

This endpoint retrieves information about a specific animal.

### Request

No request body is required for this endpoint.

#### Parameters

- `id` (path parameter) - The ID of the animal to retrieve.
    

### Response

The response will be a JSON object with the following schema:

``` json
{
   "id":"number"
   "species":{
    "id": "number",
    "zone": {
            "id": "number",
            "name": "string"
        },
    "name": "string"
   },
   "name": "string",
   "createDate": "date"
 }

 ```

#### Example

##### Request

```
GET /api/v1/species/123

 ```

##### Response

``` json
{
    "id": 1,
    "species": {
        "id": 4,
        "zone": {
            "id": 2,
            "name": "Anfibios"
        },
        "name": "Rana"
    },
    "name": "ring ring renacuajo",
    "createDate": "2024-07-26T22:51:19.6218"
}

 ```

The endpoint is used to update an existing zoo species identified by the provided ID.

## Example input

``` json
{
    "name": "Anita",
    "species":1
}

 ```

### Request Body

- `name`: (string) Animal's name
    
- species: (number) Animal's species ID
    

## Example output

``` json
{
    "id": 1,
    "species": {
        "id": 1,
        "zone": {
            "id": 1,
            "name": "Anfibios"
        },
        "name": "Salamandra"
    },
    "name": "Anita",
    "createDate": "2024-07-26T22:51:19.6218"
}

 ```

In case the animal name is already registered

```
El animal Juana ya existe.

 ```

This endpoint is used to create a new zoo animal.

## Example input

``` json
{
    "name": "Juana",
    "zone": 4
}

 ```

### Request Body

- `name`: (string) Animal's name
    
- species: (number) Animal's species ID
    

## Example output

``` json
{
    "id": 4,
    "species": {
        "id": 4,
        "zone": {
            "id": 1,
            "name": "Anfibios"
        },
        "name": "Rana"
    },
    "name": "Juana",
    "createDate": "2024-07-28T00:45:50.8292733"
}

 ```

In case the animal name is already registered

```
El animal Juana ya existe.

 ```

### Response

- `id`: (number) Animal's ID
    
- `name`: (string) Animal's name
    
- species: (object) Species to which the animal belongs
    
- createDate: (date) Date on which the animal was created

item.description: Set of endpoints that allow CRUD to be performed in the zoo's species.

item.name: Comment
item.description: Set of endpoints that allow the management of comments and responses to comments.

item.name: Auth

request.description:
This endpoint is used to authenticate a user and gain access to protected resources.

### Request Body

- `userEmain` (String): The user's email.
    
- `pass` (String): The user's password.
    

#### Example input

``` json
{
     "userEmail": "example@email.com",
     "pass": "password123"
}

 ```

### Response

The response will include the authentication details, such as the access token.

#### Example output

``` json
{
  "token": "eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJ1c2VySWQiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwiaWF0IjoxNTE2MjM5MDIyfQ.SflKxwRJSMeKKF2QT4fwpMeJf36POk6yJV_adQssw5c"
}

 ```

In case of incorrect credentials it will return

```
Internal server error: Bad credentials

 ```

This endpoint is used to register a new user of the "EMPLEADO" role. This endpoint can only be used by a user of the "ADMIN" role.

### Example input

``` json
{
  "name": "Karla Ramirez",
  "userEmail": "karlar@mail.com",
  "pass": "15karla53"
}

 ```

### Example output

``` json
{
  "id": 5,
  "name": "Karla Ramirez",
  "userEmail": "karlar@mail.com"
}

 ```

In case the Email is already registered

``` json
Ya existe un usuario con el emailempleado1@gmail.com

 ```

This endpoint is used to log out a user.

#### Request

- Body is not required on this endpoint
    
- Authentication token required
    

#### Response

- Status: 200
    
- The response does not contain any specific data.

item.description: Conjunto de endponits que permiten la autenticaci√≥n y registro de los usuarios en la api.

item.name: Search

request.description:
This endpoint makes an HTTP GET request to retrieve search results based on the provided word parameter.

## Request

#### Body

This request does not contain a request body.

#### Parameters

This request requires the following parameter:  
`word` (query param) - This is the keyword to search.

## Response Body

The response is a JSON object with the following structure:

``` json
{
  "zones": [],
  "animals": [],
  "species": [],
  "comments":[],
  "answer":[]
}

 ```

item.description: This is the service that searches for matches of a word in the records of Zone, Species, Animal, Comments and Answer

request.description:
This endpoint retrieves the count of animals for a specific species.

#### Request

- Method: GET
    
- Endpoint: `{{host}}/api/v1/animal/count-by-species/{{id}}`
    

#### Response

- Status: 200
    
- Amount of animales:
    

```
4

 ```

This endpoint retrieves the count of animals for a specific zone.

#### Request

- Method: GET
    
- Endpoint: `{{host}}/api/v1/animal/count-by-zone/{{id}}`
    
- `{{id}}:` This is the zone's ID
    

#### Response

- Status: 200
    
- Amount of animales:
    

```
10

 ```

This endpoint retrieves the count of animals for a specific zone.

#### Request

- Method: GET
    
- Endpoint: `{{host}}/api/v1/animal/count-by-zone/{{date}}`
    
- Example:
    

```
localhost:8080/api/v1/animal/count-by-zone/2024-07-26

 ```

#### Response

- Status: 200
    

``` json
[
    {
        "id": 1,
        "species": {
            "id": 1,
            "zone": {
                "id": 1,
                "name": "Anfibios"
            },
            "name": "Salamandra"
        },
        "name": "Anita",
        "createDate": "2024-07-26T22:51:19.6218"
    }
]

 ```

This endpoint retrieves the percentage of comments that have been answered.

#### Request

No request body is required for this endpoint.

#### Response

The response is a double number:

``` json
14.285714285714285

 ```

item.description:
Set of endpoints that a user with the "ADMIN" role can access and use.  
These endpoints are grouped into:

- Zone
    
- Species
    
- Anima
    
- Comment
    
- Indicators
    
- Search

item.description:
Conjunto de endpoints a los que un usuaruio de rol "EPLEADO" puede acceder y utilizar.

Estos enpoints estan agrupados en:

- Zona
    
- Especie
    
- Animal
    
- Comentarios
    
- Busqueda
